title: States Push Tax Cuts Amid Big Budgets, Inflationary Pressures
sub_head: Lawmakers in states led by both Democrats and Republicans have been calling for tax reductions
body:
States flush with cash are aiming to slash taxes as the nation’s economic recovery and infusions of federal pandemic-relief funds have stoked budget surpluses.
In Mississippi, the state Senate voted in late February to trim its grocery and state income taxes. Gov. Tate Reeves has said he wants to eliminate state income tax completely. Tennessee’s governor has proposed reducing the state’s sales tax, while Kentucky, Georgia and Wisconsin are looking into giving tax rebates or credits.
